attributes.action: ask the Central Office of Information to produce a communciation compaign with the motto "Keep Calm and Carry On" to guide the nation during these difficult times
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
During the early days of the Second World War, the Ministry of Information produced designs for three posters intended to reassure the general public during the difficult times which lay ahead. Each design communicated a  simple message in a bold format which would allay uncertainty but the one with the slogan "Keep Calm and Carry On" was held back, only to be issued in a time of acute crisis and in fact was never fully published. 

Its bold design and exhortation to maintain "phlegm and fortitude" in the face of adversity under the watchful eye of the crown resonates strongly in our current troubled times.

Surely it is time for GB our current PM to take on the mantle of WC, our great wartime leader, and battle across the fields of financial fire to a safer harbour, and to do so armed with an appropriate mantra?

There can be no better candidate for the saying which will guide the nation than "Keep Calm and Carry On".
